definition: to kick a ball around/(fig.) to mutually shirk responsibility/to pass the buck
to kick/to play (e.g. soccer)/(slang) butch (in a lesbian relationship)
leather/skin/fur/CL:張|张[zhang1]/pico- (one trillionth)/naughty
surname Pi
ball/sphere/globe/CL:個|个[ge4]/ball game/match/CL:場|场[chang3]

sentences.english: What you need to do is kick a ball into each of the three green balloons.
sentences.chinese: 你需要做的是踢皮球到三个绿色的气球。

definition: mutually shirking responsibilities (idiom); each blaming the other/passing the buck to and fro/each trying to unload responsibilities onto the other
to pass the buck/to shirk responsibility
to wrangle/wrangling
to decline/to avoid/shirking responsibilities/to blame others/to pass the buck/to unload one's responsibilities/to try to get out of a task
to try to smooth things over/to paper over the issues/to gloss things over
to skimp on the job/to work half-heartedly/not to take the job seriously
variant of 推諉|推诿[tui1 wei3]
to seek an audience with higher-ups (esp. government officials) to petition for sth
see 和稀泥[huo4 xi1 ni2]
to talk officiously/to assume the air of a functionary/to talk in official jargon
to tell on sb/to complain (to a teacher, a superior etc)/to bring a lawsuit
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
to use all sorts of excuses
see 耍滑[shua3 hua2]
(Internet slang) to shift the blame/to pass the buck
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
